DOC.brief_summary: Objective- The purpose of this study is to evaluate a connection between PH,PCO2,HCO3,PO2,Na,K,Glu and Lactate patterns in vacuum drains of different plastic operational wounds and its relation to infections and seroma formation.
DOC.brief_title: Acid Base and Electrolytes Patterns in Drains Operational Wounds and Its Relation to Complications
DOC.detailed_description: our objective is evaluation of a connection between PH,PCO2,HCO3,PO2,Na,K,Glu and Lactate patterns in vacum drains of different plastic operational wounds and its relation to infections and seroma formation. it is possible that early changes in this values might point out an infection or seroma formation of a wound before clinical signs appear.
DOC.criteria: all post operational patients who have a vacum drain/s patients who are unable to sign a Consent Form (demented,Alzheimer's disease ...) patients who refuse participation
